fields.Name: intro
fields.Markdown:
Yes, weâ€™re back!

We are back, but we are staying safe. For this year, we will be doing a hybrid event. The Evergreen Phage Meeting will meet August 1 through August 6. We are still determining if the meeting will be held virtually, in-person, or in a combination. ## Hybrid event What does it mean? Let's find out!

fields.Name: terms
fields.Markdown:
# Site Policy

- Your name, email, and other information that you provide on signup forms will be visible and used by Phage Directory and Evergreen Phage Meeting staff. 
- Your information will not be shared, sold or traded with any third parties, affiliates, or sponsors.

fields.Name: Sign Up to Present
fields.Description: Our seminar schedule is filling up fast! If you're interested in giving a phage talk (they're usually around 15 minutes) to a small audience of phage enthusiasts, sign up below!

fields.Topic: From the environment to bedside: Understanding the basics of phage therapy research
fields.Name: APF Webinar 1
fields.Description:
<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fYg9m4EGb38" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

The endpoint for phage research is to get it to the bedside for clinical phages or to formulate a product that will meet the needs of the end user. What are the basics involved from isolation of phages from the environment to getting it to a final product? The Africa Phage Forum (APF) therefore invites you to a webinar on the topic " From the environment to the bedside: Understanding the basics of phage therapy research"
fields.Email Template:
Hi {{name}}, thanks for signing up to {{eventName}}!

The event is currently set to take place January 14, 2021 at 4pm GMT (11am EST). You will receive an email confirming the date and time closer to the event. 

At the time of the event, please use this Zoom link to attend: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82020308949?pwd=aUdwOGV2a2ZSY3ZXY0d4K2FpSENKQT09

We will also post the link to the website on the day of the event, here: https://apf.phage.directory

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to write us at info@phage.directory.

To unsubscribe at any time, please forward an email with "unsubscribe" and the event you'd like to be removed from in the subject or body to apf@phage.directory and we'll take you off the list. 

Again, thanks for signing up!

â€” Africa Phage Forum & Phage Directory

fields.Topic: Basics of phage genome annotation and classification - how to get started
fields.Name: APF Webinar 2
fields.Description: Isolating a new bacteriophage is the first step in an exciting journey, not just in the laboratory, but also computationally. In this seminar, I will provide a basic guide into the steps involved in phage genome sequencing, annotation and classification.

fields.Topic: Practical challenges and possible solutions in phage research. A question and answer session
fields.Name: APF Webinar 3
fields.Date: Coming in March, more details to be announced

fields.Name: Prof. Paul Turner
fields.Short: Rachel Carson Professor of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology; Microbiology Faculty, Yale School of Medicine

fields.Name: Evelien Adriaenssens
fields.Short: I am a Group Leader at the Quadram Institute Bioscience in Norwich (UK). Iâ€™m interested in phage discovery, genomics, taxonomy and viromics, and lead a group that investigates the role of phages in the human gut. Before starting my own group, I worked as a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Pretoria in South Africa on the diversity of viruses in desert soils, and later at the University of Liverpool on the use of viromics methods to trace pathogenic viruses across the aquatic environment. â€¨I am currently the Chair of the Bacterial Viruses Subcommittee of the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses (ICTV).
